snippet: In districts where the insurgency is strongest, the Taliban did not have to pick up rifles to disrupt the vote.
abstract: Fear of reprisal from the Taliban keep many voters in Shinwar and other rural areas of Afghanistan from casting ballots in presidential election; low turnout is in distinct contrast to high level of participation in Kabul and other cities.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul, and Khalid Alokozay from Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: In districts where the insurgency is strongest, the Taliban did not have to pick up rifles to disrupt the vote.

headline.main: Apathy and Fear of Taliban Combine to Keep Rural Voters Away From the Polls
headline.print_headline: Apathy and Fear of Taliban Combine to Keep Rural Voters Away From the Polls
